name: Location Manager
description: I want to be able to figure save where I am as a location of interest, so I can quickly access it later. It's inspired by a use-case I had in Taiwan (I'm Taiwanese, so I'll regularly go back to visit my family). Anyways, I walked out of our Airbnb and realized I didn't have the address saved. I didn't book the Airbnb or have the Airbnb app, so it was hard to find, and using Google Maps isn't great as saving your current location is a hard to find feature that takes several clicks (Google Maps's UI is also very crowded in general). I eventually figured out how to do this in Google Maps, but even after saving the location, saved locations are not a first class citizen in Google Maps, so it's hard returning to them.

stories.name: App structure
stories.description: The app consists of four (4) pages. Build out the app structure by stubbing out each.
requirements: Home page includes site navigation in the header, map, and Save Current Location Button (the black plus button)

stories.name: Home Page
stories.description: Displays the user's current location on the map and provides navigation access to the rest of the app.
requirements: The user's current locations is displayed with an icon which is centered on the map
Tapping the Saved Locations button in the header navigates to the Saved Locations page
Tapping the Search button navigates the user to the Search page
Tapping the Save Current Location button (black plus button) navigates the user to the Save Current Location page

stories.name: Save Current Location
stories.description: When the user taps the Save Current Location button (black plus button on the home page), they can save their current location
requirements: Allow the user to enter a name for their current location
Do not allow the location to be saved until a name is entered (ie. Name is required)
When the user taps the Save button from the Save Current Location page the location is saved and the user is routed to the Saved Locations page
The newly saved location is visible in the list of saved locations

stories.name: Saved Locations
stories.description: This page displays the user's saved locations and they can navigate to them
requirements: Tapping the Travel To button navigates the user to the home page displaying the route to the location they selected from their current location

stories.name: Search Page
stories.description: The user can search for named places.
requirements: As the user types provide autocomplete place options for the user to select from
When the user selects a place the dropdown is removed and the place they selected is displayed
Tapping the Save button saves the place to the user's saved places and navigates the user to the Saved Places page
The newly saved location is visible in the list of saved locations
The name of the newly saved location defaults to the name of the place supplied by the API
